title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned if considers g'(x)=0

1 point is earned for x=-1 and x=1

1 point is earned for answers with justification

The graph of g has a horizontal tangent line where

g'(x)=f(x)=0. This occurs at x=-1 and x=1. g'(x) changes sign from positive to negative at x=-1. Therefore, g has a relative maximum at x=-1. g'(x) does not change sign at x=1. Therefore, g has neither a relative maximum nor a relative minimum at x=1.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned if considers g'(x)=0

1 point is earned for x=-1 and x=1

1 point is earned for answers with justification

The graph of g has a horizontal tangent line where

g'(x)=f(x)=0. This occurs at x=-1 and x=1.

g'(x) changes sign from positive to negative at x=-1. Therefore, g has a relative maximum at x=-1.

g'(x) does not change sign at x=1. Therefore, g has neither a relative maximum nor a relative minimum at x=1.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned if considers g'(x)=0

1 point is earned for x=-1 and x=1

1 point is earned for answers with justification

g'(x) changes sign from positive to negative at x=-1. Therefore, g has a relative maximum at x=-1.

g'(x) does not change sign at x=1. Therefore, g has neither a relative maximum nor a relative minimum at x=1.

1 point is earned for x=-1 and x=1

1 point is earned for answers with justification

g'(x) does not change sign at x=1. Therefore, g has neither a relative maximum nor a relative minimum at x=1.

g'(x)=f(x)=0. This occurs at x=-1 and x=1.

g'(x) changes sign from positive to negative at x=-1. Therefore, g has a relative maximum at x=-1.

g'(x) does not change sign at x=1. Therefore, g has neither a relative maximum nor a relative minimum at x=1.
